title: Practicing Endings – Order in God’s Language
goals: Strengthen pronunciation and recall through chant and gesture
Connect grammatical order to God’s order in creation

steps.speak: Salve iterum! Let’s begin with our chant: Salve, vale, pax, Deus, rosa!
Faith phrase: Pax vobiscum – Peace be with you. Let’s say it together with hands open in peace.
Review time! Rosa means 'the rose' when it does the action. Rosam means 'the rose' when it receives the action. Say each one with gestures.
Now meet our new word: aqua – water. Aqua is subject, aquam is object. Repeat after me: aqua, aquam!
Let’s chant both together: rosa, rosam – aqua, aquam!
Practice sentences: Aqua fluit – The water flows. Video aquam – I see the water. Chant and translate!
Now combine: Rosa floret et aqua fluit – The rose blooms and the water flows.
Quick quiz! I’ll say a word; you show me: subject or object? Ready? Rosa… Rosam… Aqua… Aquam…
Faith reflection: God made order in creation—water flows, flowers bloom. Latin shows order too, with each ending in its place.
Optime! You’re learning to see order and beauty in every word. Tomorrow we’ll celebrate what we’ve learned! Vale!
